inhibit.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to prevent something from growing or developing well
inhibit.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: An unhappy family life may inhibit childrenâ€™s learning.
inhibit.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make someone feel embarrassed or nervous so that they cannot do or say what they want to
inhibit.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Recording the meeting may inhibit people from expressing their real views.
inhibit.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to prevent something from growing or developing in the way that it could or being as good as it should be
inhibit.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Air fares tend to be higher at airports where certain factors inhibit competition among airlines.
